intro: Phyteuma orbiculare f. hispidum, commonly known as the hairy orbiculate phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, orbicular-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This cultivar is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
